important: The client wants us to sound as ONE person
send_to_cs: Send to CS if cx sends photos of items from the website or if photos/screenshots are not coming through
escalate: Go the extra mile for cx's - ESC any q's you're unsure of
When ESC on weekdays, use ESC shortcut
When ESC on weekends, use WKD shortcut
ESC if a cx doesn't want to sign the package / provide a signature when receiving their order
ESC if a cx wants to know when an item will be available/back in stock
ESC if a cx wants to know where an item is shipped from
ESC immediately if a cx has an issue applying a code that we didn't share (it's not in the UI or website)
templates: If a cx is asking for updates after we've escalated - use DUP shortcut. Don't tell the cx, you haven't heard back
If a cx shares an incorrect response to the Journey asking them to share their birthday month - use BRE shortcut
tone: Do not take responsibility and directly apologize when the issue is not caused by the brand and all systems are functioning as intended
If the client takes over, do NOT send a message before 5 PM EST on the day the client responded
If the convo is escalated, do NOT send a message before 5 PM EST on the day it was escalated
drive_to_purchase: Don't tell cx's we'll restock an item which is not available on the website
dos_and_donts: Do not say that "my system is limited", limited access" or similar phrases
Do not say "I don't have better deals", "I don't have any codes available", or similar phrases
Do not say "sales collection", say "sale collection"
promo_and_exclusions: We have a brand-specific CWW template
If a cx shows any purchase intent, always share our code.
If cx asks for a percentage code, share 10WELCOME code for 10% off
Cx's can use a code and receive free shipping as well
